title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement info@marineregions.org. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

what: Retrieving the Marine Regions Gazetteer as RDF
title: mregions2 as RDF
text: Known MRGID, can get gazetter entry RDF. E.g. Belgian Exclusive Economic Zone Belgian Part North Sea MRGID: https://marineregions.org/mrgid/3293 Using gaz_search() underlying service gaz_rest_record_by_mrgid() argument rdf = TRUE : Use content negotiation get MRGID Turtle format. Read document RDF using rdflib R package (?rdflib::rdflib) HTTP requests handled httr2 (?httr2::httr2) many stores returned. returned object includes info Gazetteer record, also hierarchy. Marine Regions Gazetteer hierarchical many relations records relations explained Marine Regions Ontology: http://marineregions.org/ns/ontology also information Place Type. Place Types defined : http://marineregions.org/ns/placetypes ontology placetypes available HTML using web browser, also Turtle JSON-LD using content negotiation. can use rdflib::rdflib apply common RDF applications.
code: gaz_search(3293) %>%    gaz_geometry() %>%   mapview() bpns <- gaz_search(3293, rdf = TRUE)  class(bpns) #> [1] "rdf"  bpns #> Total of 101 triples, stored in hashes #> ------------------------------- #> @base <localhost://> . #> @prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> . #>  #> <http://marineregions.org/mrgid/14> #>     a <http://marineregions.org/ns/ontology#MRGeoObject>, <http://marineregions.org/ns/placetypes#Nation> ; #>     <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#prefLabel> "Belgium"@en . #>  #> <http://marineregions.org/mrgid/17401> #>     a <http://marineregions.org/ns/ontology#MRGeoObject>, <http://marineregions.org/ns/placetypes#Wreck> ; #>     <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#prefLabel> "Birkenfels"@en . #>  #> ... with 91 more triples

title: mregions2 as RDF
text: Using SPARQL syntax can extract label record specific language, available. , preferred label returned Example: Get Gazetteer entry “Belgium” MRGID <http://marineregions.org/mrgid/14> extract label Dutch (nl) available.
code: belgium <- gaz_search(14, rdf = TRUE)  sparql <- '   PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>   SELECT (COALESCE(?altLabel, ?prefLabel) AS ?o)   WHERE {     OPTIONAL {       ?s skos:altLabel ?altLabel .       filter langMatches(lang(?altLabel), "nl")     }     ?s skos:prefLabel ?prefLabel .   } '  rdf_query(belgium, query = sparql) #> # A tibble: 1 × 1 #>   o      #>   <chr>  #> 1 België

what: Mirror the Marine Regions Gazetteer using the LDES Feed
title: mregions2 as RDF
text: Marine Regions Gazetteer accessible RDF, can mirrored synchronized via Linked Data Event Streams (LDES). described high detail : Lonneville B. et al. (2021) Publishing Marine Regions Gazetteer Linked Data Event Stream. S4BioDiv 2021. http://ceur-ws.org/Vol-2969/paper8-s4biodiv.pdf Building API R , moment, scope mregions2. However, interested user make use mregions2 rdflib::rdflib mirror Marine Regions Gazetteer. general approach described :

previous_headings: Mirror the Marine Regions Gazetteer using the LDES Feed
title: mregions2 as RDF
text: design, mregions2 stores RDF triples memory. package aim replicating Marine Regions Gazetteer, consult small subsets. rdflib::rdflib allows store triples database. explained vignette("storage", package = "rdflib"). example, using Virtuoso database backend possible. Virtuoso popular open source database RDF.
code: triplestore <- rdf(storage = "virtuoso",                     user = "dba",                     password = "dba",                     dsn = "Local Virtuoso"                    )  # Turn bpns into nquads tmp <- tempfile(fileext = ".nq") write_nquads(bpns, tmp)  # Parse bpns as nquads into the store rdf_parse(tmp, format = "nquads", rdf = triplestore)

previous_headings: Mirror the Marine Regions Gazetteer using the LDES Feed
title: mregions2 as RDF
text: LDES feed available : https://marineregions.org/feed offers fragmentation whole Marine Regions Gazetteer based last modification time ?MRGID. primary use make easy external caches, replications, derived indexes efficient incremental way. implementation start fetching feed start page follow tree:relation paths pages contain tree:member entries older requested date. Source: https://github.com/ropensci/mregions/pull/62#issuecomment-1091837752

what: Wasn’t there a package to read Marine Regions already? mregions?
title: Introduction to mregions2
text: mregions2 supersedes mregions. need mregions2 explained article: mregions mregions2? NOTE naming mrp_*() instead mr_() decided avoid overlapping functions mregions

title: Introduction to mregions2
text: Geocoding marine places possible mregions2. bare minimum, entries Marine Regions Gazetteer always centroid feature, fields latitude longitude. bounding box feature may also available via fields minLatitude, maxLatitude, minLongitude maxLongitude. Moreover, many entries Marine Regions Gazetteer actual geometries associated. typically Polygons Linestrings. avoid overloading server, geometries returned default gaz_search(). Adding geometries possible gaz_geometry(): passing result gaz_search() turn data frame sf::sf object geometry field the_geom, class sf::sfc. possible cause result gaz_search data frame including class mr_df, unique mregions2 R package. geometry function S3 method defined class: gaz_geometry.mr_df(). can also use argument with_geometry gaz_search(3293, with_geometry = TRUE) load geometry directly. addition, fetching geometries possible using MRGID gaz_geometry() default, simple feature geometry list column, object class sf::sfc. formats possible: Well-Known Text (WKT):

title: Introduction to mregions2
text: sf::sf object: Learn using mregions2 access Marine Regions Gazetteer RDF article.

title: Introduction to mregions2
text: mregions2 can access Marine Regions Gazetteer using RESTful web services. set functions mregions2 named gaz_rest_*() read web services via HTTP. closer definition web services. gazetteer functions shown make use set functions.

what: Marine Regions Gazetteer as RDF - Open Linked Data
title: Introduction to mregions2
text: can read Marine Regions Gazetteer Open Linked Data. See Marine Regions Gazetteer RDF article information.

title: Introduction to mregions2
text: main function load Marine Regions Data Product R mrp_get(). select data product, pass layer argument. However, expensive request may take time complete. better approach first quick look instead downloading full product. mrp_view() renders interactive visualization: returns leaflet::leaflet interactive map data product requested added via Web Map Services. Note leaflet::leaflet leaflet.extras2::leaflet.extras2 required mrp_view() listed “Suggests”. Install packages use mrp_view().

title: Introduction to mregions2
text: cases, may interested retrieving certain amount records. filter features. download product mrp_get() apply filter R base Tidyverse (tidyverse::tidyverse). getting full product slow: Instead, can write filter applied server side: filter written Contextual Query Language (CQL). relatively simple syntax close SQL.
code: system.time({   ecs <- mrp_get("ecs") %>% filter(sovereign1 == "Portugal") }) #>    user  system elapsed  #>   1.591   0.025   3.532 system.time({   ecs <- mrp_get("ecs", cql_filter = "sovereign1 = 'Portugal'") }) #>    user  system elapsed  #>  34.168   0.011  34.862

title: Introduction to mregions2
text: Writing filters can challenging without knowing advance names columns data product, unique values columns . retrieve full product get know columns values , well, filter misses bit point. mregions2 two helpers help mission: mrp_colnames() gets data frame columns data type data product. mrp_col_unique() (mrp_col_distinct(), synonyms) returns unique values column data product.
code: # Columns of the Extended Continental Shelves data product mrp_colnames("ecs") #> # A tibble: 63 × 3 #>    layer colname    type   #>  * <chr> <chr>      <chr>  #>  1 ecs   geoname    string #>  2 ecs   pol_type   string #>  3 ecs   territory1 string #>  4 ecs   mrgid_ter1 string #>  5 ecs   iso_ter1   string #>  6 ecs   un_ter1    string #>  7 ecs   sovereign1 string #>  8 ecs   mrgid_sov1 string #>  9 ecs   iso_sov1   string #> 10 ecs   un_sov1    string #> # title: Introduction to mregions2
text: many types filter allowed via standard OGC CQL filters. mrp_get() mrp_view() use OGC WFS WMS respectively. can also limit number features requested count parameter. mrp_view() uses leaflet.extras2::addWMS(), enables passing filters together base URL argument baseURL. can also apply standard OGC filter specification. however verbose: Note data products Marine Regions served via VLIZ geoserver. Geoserver implements powerful extension CQL called ECQL (Extended CQL). allows expressing full range filters OGC Filter 1.1 can encode. ECQL accepted many places GeoServer. Whenever documentation refers CQL, ECQL syntax can used well. recommend vignette("ecql_filtering", package = "EMODnetWFS") ?EMODnetWFS::EMODnetWFS R package know . principles explained useful also mregions2.
code: # Get only one feature mrp_get("ecs", count = 1) #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 63 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -28.0213 ymin: 177.0364 xmax: -26.12738 ymax: 177.5697 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 1 × 64 #>   geoname  pol_type territory1 mrgid_ter1 iso_ter1 un_ter1 sovereign1 mrgid_sov1 #> * <chr>    <chr>    <chr>           <int> <chr>      <int> <chr>           <int> #> 1 Overlap… ECS Ove… New Zeala…       2227 NZL          554 New Zeala…       2227 #> # ℹ 56 more variables: iso_sov1 <chr>, un_sov1 <int>, territory2 <chr>, #> #   mrgid_ter2 <int>, iso_ter2 <chr>, un_ter2 <int>, sovereign2 <chr>, #> #   mrgid_sov2 <int>, iso_sov2 <chr>, un_sov2 <int>, territory3 <lgl>, #> #   mrgid_ter3 <lgl>, iso_ter3 <lgl>, un_ter3 <lgl>, sovereign3 <lgl>, #> #   mrgid_sov3 <lgl>, iso_sov3 <lgl>, un_sov3 <lgl>, territory4 <lgl>, #> #   mrgid_ter4 <lgl>, iso_ter4 <lgl>, un_ter4 <lgl>, sovereign4 <lgl>, #> #   mrgid_sov4 <lgl>, iso_sov4 <lgl>, un_sov4 <lgl>, territory5 <lgl>, … # View all Joint submissions, recommendations of deposit to DOALOS with an area larger than 1M square kilometers verbose <- "   pol_type IN (     'ECS Joint CLCS Recommendation',      'ECS Joint CLCS Submission',      'ECS Joint DOALOS Deposit'   )    AND area_km2 > 1000000 " mrp_view("ecs", cql_filter = verbose) # View the Extended Continental Shelf of Portugal verbose <- "   <Filter>     <PropertyIsEqualTo>         <PropertyName>sovereign1</PropertyName>         <Literal>Portugal</Literal>     </PropertyIsEqualTo>   </Filter> " mrp_view("ecs", filter = verbose)

title: Why mregions and mregions2?
text: 2021, new web services developed access Marine Regions Gazetteer. essence, two major changes happened: database can accessed now Open Linked Data standards: JSON-LD Turtle. geometry associated gazetteer record now available RESTful services. information : Lonneville B. et al. (2021) Publishing Marine Regions Gazetteer Linked Data Event Stream. S4BioDiv 2021. http://ceur-ws.org/Vol-2969/paper8-s4biodiv.pdf package uses two new functionalities serve geometries R sf::sf objects, allows retrieve Gazetteer database rdflib::rdf objects. See Marine Regions Gazetteer RDF article information.

title: Access data from marineregions.org: the Marine Regions Gazetteer and the Marine Regions Data Products
text: Marine Regions Gazetteer standard list marine georeferenced place names. Gazetteer: dictionary geographical names. https://www.thefreedictionary.com/gazetteer can search Gazetteer many ways: Search free text: Search unique identifier. See MRGID: Search location: Search place type: Search authortative source: list place types sources available gaz_types() gaz_sources() respectively. can add geometry Gazetteer entries gaz_geometry(): entries Marine Regions Gazetteer organized hierarchically. can browse hierarchy gaz_relations()

title: Access data from marineregions.org: the Marine Regions Gazetteer and the Marine Regions Data Products
text: addition Marine Regions Gazetteer, Marine Regions Team creates hosts geographical Data Products, popular one Marine Regions Maritime Boundaries. overview available products can consulted mrp_list can visualize Marine Regions Data Products mrp_view(). opens interactive leaflet::leaflet viewer.  can load data products R mrp_get() Get know Get Started vignette.
code: mrp_list #> Memoised Function: #> function() { #>   # Avoid "no visible binding for global variable" R CMD Check NOTE #>   title <- abstract <- data_product <- product_layer <- geoserverID <- NULL #>   license <- citation <- doi <- imis <- abstract <- id <- NULL #>  #>   mrp_list <- utils::read.delim2( #>     system.file("mrp_list.csv", package = "mregions2"), #>     header = TRUE, #>     sep = ";", #>     dec = ".", #>     fileEncoding = "UTF-8" #>   ) %>% dplyr::mutate( #>     geoserverID = glue::glue("{product_namespace}:{product_layer}") #>   ) #>  #>   # Get Info from WFS #>   wfs <- mrp_init_wfs_client(silent = TRUE) #>   capabilities <- wfs$getCapabilities() #>   caps_ft <- purrr::map(mrp_list$geoserverID, ~ capabilities$findFeatureTypeByName(.x)) #>  #>   mrp_list <- mrp_list %>% dplyr::mutate( #>     title = purrr::map_chr(caps_ft, ~ .x$getTitle()), #>     abstract = purrr::map_chr(caps_ft, ~ .x$getAbstract()) #>   ) %>% dplyr::select( #>     title, #>     data_product = product_layer, #>     license, #>     citation, #>     doi, #>     imis, #>     abstract, #>     id = geoserverID #>   ) #>  #>   # Turn into tibble #>   attr(mrp_list, "class") <- c("tbl_df", "tbl", "data.frame") #>  #>   mrp_list #> } #> <environment: namespace:mregions2> mrp_view("eez") mrp_get("eez") #> Simple feature collection with 281 features and 31 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -180 ymin: -85.5625 xmax: 180 ymax: 86.99401 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # title: Marine Regions Global Identifier (MRGID) — MRGID
text: Many functions mregions2 make use argument mrgid return data numeric variable MRGID. identifier? unique persistent identifier entry Marine Regions Gazetteer. identifier consists URI containing number, unique entry Marine Regions Gazetteer. R package mregions2 uses number functions, considered synonym standard definition MRGID. See section details depth definition MRGID

title: Marine Regions Global Identifier (MRGID) — MRGID

title: Marine Regions Global Identifier (MRGID) — MRGID
text: Place names change time, names may used different locations. Available gazetteers may find locations marine place names, truly global standard marine place names lacking. Marine Regions tries establish first time standardized list georeferenced marine place names marine areas. order preserve identity marine geographic objects database, name locate geographic resources web, promote Marine Regions Geographic IDentifier, MRGID.

title: Marine Regions Global Identifier (MRGID) — MRGID
text: Marine Regions Geographic IDentifier : unique using URI (Uniform Resource Identifier), unique across internet. Syntax http://marineregions.org/mrgid/<number> persistent never delete, change concept behind MRGID resolvable pointing client MRGID return - reply webservice call getGazetteerRecordByMRGID, using content negotiation (text/turtle application/ld+json) - webpage MRGID, using browser identifier persistent, requires governing body arrange identifier available long term. Use MRGID, URI persistent identifier commitment Flanders Marine Institute, issuing identifier maintain http domain registration, strategy managing domain web servers.

title: Get the geometries of a Marine Regions Geo-Object — gaz_geometry
text: x object retrieve geometries . Accepted: (integer) valid Marine Regions Gazetteer Identifier (MRGID) data frame retrieved mregions2 via functions gaz_search(), gaz_search_by_source(), gaz_search_by_type() gaz_relations(). See details. ... Arguments passed gaz_rest_geometries format (character) preferred output format. One : "sfc": Simple Feature geometry object. See 'sf' "wkt": Geometry representation Well-Known Text "rdf": Geometry object class 'rdf". See 'rdflib' Default "sfc" multipart (logical) Geo-Objects compound one part. FALSE, returns singlepart geometries (e.g. POLYGON, LINESTRING) TRUE (default), returns multipart geometries (e.g. MULTIPOLYGON, MULTILINESTRING)

title: Get a data product — mrp_get
text: Contextual Query Language (CQL) filter standard OGC filter specification allow query server performing request. boost performance retrieve area interest. possible query attributes, also perform geospatial queries. instance, can query bounding box interest. CQL filters possible geoserver. Marine Regions uses geoserver instance serve data products. tutorial CQL filters available geoserver web site.

title: Get a data product — mrp_get
code: if (FALSE) { # See the list of all data products View(mrp_list)  # We want the Exclusive Economic Zones of Portugal. Let's first visualize the product: mrp_view("eez")  # See all the columns on this data product mrp_colnames("eez")  # We should query on sovereign # See all the possible values of sovereign1, sovereign2 and sovereign3 sov1 = mrp_col_unique("eez", "sovereign1") sov2 = mrp_col_unique("eez", "sovereign2") sov3 = mrp_col_unique("eez", "sovereign3")  # Is Portugal a value in the sovereign1, 2 and 3? "Portugal" %in% sov1 #> [1] TRUE  "Portugal" %in% sov2 #> [1] FALSE  "Portugal" %in% sov3 #> [1] FALSE  # Portugal is only in sovereign1. Let's write a CQL filter to get only # the EEZs of Portugal, or those where Portugal is a party of a dispute or a joint regime portugal_eez <- mrp_get("eez", cql_filter = "sovereign1 = 'Portugal'")  # You can also limit the number of features to be requested mrp_get("eez", count = 5) }

title: Visualize a Marine Regions data product without downloading — mrp_view
code: if (FALSE) { # You can pass a product name from mrp_list mrp_view('eez')  # Or use the helper mrp_view_eez()  # Example: filter a the Ecoregions 'Azores Canaries Madeira' with mrgid 21885 # You can check the names of the columns beforehand with mrp_colnames('ecoregions') mrp_view_ecoregions(filter = "   <Filter>     <PropertyIsEqualTo>       <PropertyName>ecoregion</PropertyName>       <Literal>Azores Canaries Madeira</Literal>     </PropertyIsEqualTo>   </Filter> ")  # OGC filter are very verbose... but luckily you can use a CQL filter instead mrp_view_ecoregions(cql_filter = "ecoregion = 'Azores Canaries Madeira'")  # View all the Extended Continental Shelf (ECS) boundary lines published during the first # decade of the 21st century mrp_view_ecs_boundaries(   cql_filter = "doc_date > '2000-01-01' AND doc_date < '2009-12-31'" )  # Or as timestamp mrp_view_eez_boundaries(   cql_filter = "doc_date AFTER 2000-01-01T00:00:00Z AND doc_date BEFORE 2009-12-31T00:00:00Z" ) }
